name: Bethel’s Heavenly Hands
description: Food distribution - groceries every week, except for 5th week of the month; pick-up on Tuesday mornings

name: Senior Box Program
description: Food distribution - monthly box of food for low income seniors provided by Houston Food Bank

name: Bread of Life
description: Food distribution - food boxes provided twice a month to anyone in need; pick-up always on Saturday mornings

name: IMPACT Resource Center
description: Food distribution - provides prepared meals and pantry staples, open to all, pick-up on Tuesday mornings + Wednesday evenings

name: India House
description: Food distribution - provides two monthly food distributions to anyone in Houston

name: Loaves and Fishes Soup Kitchen
description: Free, hot, home-cooked lunches provided from Tuesday to Sunday, lunch line begins at 10:30 AM (lunch starts at 11AM)
hours: Tuesday to Sunday, lunch line begins at 10:30 AM

name: Trinity Episcopal Kitchen
description: Food distribution - walk-in lunch program providing one bagged lunch per person

name: TANF
description: Texas govt. program providing monthly assistance payments to eligible families; can use on groceries, housing, etc.

name: Urban Harvest
description: Mobile farmers' market for anyone; those with SNAP benefits can earn money to buy more produce

name: Women, Infants, and Children Benefits
description: Government food benefits for pregnant women, new mothers, children up to age 5; can qualify for SNAP and WIC

name: Family Servants of Divine Providence
description: Provides free funding and materials for school for those in need; includes school fees, boarding fees, tutoring, etc
eligibility: financial difficulty with attending school or studying a trade
accepted into a program of study

name: Harris County Department of Education - Adult Education Classes
description: Free classes for adults in topics such as GED, ESL, citizenship, certifications, etc.

name: Bridge for Education - Sentinels of Freedom
description: Free support program helping wounded veterans with post-secondary education or vocational education plans

name: Migrant Education Program - HISD
description: Free program providing help to migrant students to succeed in school/ achieve post-secondary education or employment
eligibility: migrant children (under 23 yrs old) without a high school diploma/GED

name: Education Based Housing - Adult Education & Classes
description: Offer educational opportunities such as GED prep classes, computer skills training, etc. at a reduced cost

name: Vocational Rehabilitation Youth & Students Program
description: Free program providing help with post-secondary education/employment to disabled youth

name: Christian Community Service Center
description: Provides emergency food, clothing, and limited financial assistance to individuals and families with low income.

name: Utilities Assistance Program
description: Helps families and individuals with the payment of their electricity and gas bills.
eligibility: must be from Brazoria, Galveston or Harris County

name: Catholic Charities of the Archdiocese of Galveston-Houston
description: Provide rental assistance for past-due rent to help eligible tenants who are in danger of eviction.

name: Mumineen Relief Project (MRP)
description: This program provides rental and utility assistance, a food pantry, and a computer resource lab.

name: Patches of Light
description: Assists families with children facing catastrophic health issues and financial hardship. This program provides: 1) Help pay for utilities. 2) Help pay for housing. 3) Provides Gas cards. 4) Grocery cards.
eligibility: child must be diagnosed with a chronic illness that requires the family to forego their normal schedule of support

name: Justice For All Immigrants (JFAI)
description: Provides low-income individuals and families with affordable, high quality immigration services

name: St. Frances Carbrini Center for Immigrant Legal Assistance
description: Provides legal assistance to families and individuals who are immigrants and refugees.

name: U.S. Committee for Refugees and Immigrants (USCRI)
description: Offers low-cost, professional legal representation to low-income refugees and immigrants and their families with family- and humanitarian-based immigration matters.
services: Self-Petitions for Battered Spouses and Children

name: Somali Bantu Community of Greater Houston
description: Provides free citizenship classes for immigrants and non-U.S. citizens to obtain their citizenship. The classes are taught in English, Somali, Spanish, and Swahili.

name: USAHELLO Classroom
description: Offers their free US Citizenship Test Prep Class to anyone in need, but targets refugees and immigrants looking to become citizens.

name: HOUSTON AREA WOMEN'S CENTER
description: Domestic Violence Counseling Program: Individual, group, community-based counseling, and advocacy services such as expert testimonies in civil and criminal cases for survivors of domestic violence. 24-Hour Domestic Violence Hotline. Shelter Program: Provides safety and support with access to a host of programs, resources and support staff to individuals and families fleeing from abuse.
hours: Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 9 PM; Saturdays from 9 AM to 5 PM

name: AID TO VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC ABUSE (AVDA), INC.
description: Provides a wide range of victim advocacy services for anyone who has been a victim of abuse.

name: The Montrose Center (Anti-Violence Program for LGBTQ+)
description: Provides counseling and case management to individuals who are homosexual, bisexual, survivors of same sex domestic violence, sexual assault or hate crimes. They also provide an emergency shelter for up to 14 days and transitional living for victims of domestic violence.
eligibility: survivors of same sex domestic violence
sexual assault or hate crime victims
hours: Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 9 PM

name: Harris Health System (Gold Card)
description: Each clinic location offers services such as health care visits for diabetes, high blood pressure, or other health related illnesses. The clinics offer immunizations, yearly physicals, HIV/Hepatitis C testing, and other blood tests. At each location, social workers and or case managers can help with finding transportation, employment, housing, identification, and mental health services.

name: Caroline Street Clinic
hours: Mon-Thu: 8:00 am - 4:30 pm; Fri: 8:00 am - 12:00 pm

name: Lord of the Streets Vision Clinic
description: Provides free vision services including eye exams and glasses.

name: Intensive Outpatient Drug & Alcohol Treatment by ADAPT
description: Outpatient program involving counseling, relapse prevention, discharge planning, etc.

name: Online Alcohol Treatment by Monument
description: Physician consultations via telehealth, virtual therapy, medication options

name: Substance Use Disorder Program
description: Outpatient and residential treatment options for veterans struggling with substance use
eligibility: Veterans of active military, naval or air service

name: Alternative Substance Abuse Treatment Program
description: Involves free counseling, educational + medical referrals, support groups (gender-specific groups + Spanish groups available)
eligibility: anyone attempting to recover from substance use disorders

name: Residential Drug Treatment Program
description: Residential treatment for 30 or 60 day periods

name: 12 Step Recovery by Lamba Center Houston
description: 12 step daily or weekly recovery services for LGBTQ+ individuals and allies struggling with addiction; $20/month membership fee

name: Healthcare for the Homeless Houston
description: Provides dental exams, X-rays, dental cleanings, dentures, cancer screenings, preventive services.

name: Eastwood Health Center by El Centro de Corazon
description: Provides dental exams, cleanings, fillings, simple extractions.
eligibility: Anyone in need of dental care
requirements: Sliding scale based on income/household size

name: South Texas Dental of Houston
description: Provides general dentistry (cleaning, exams), oral surgery, orthodontics.

name: Avenue 360
description: Provides dental care, oral surgery, general dentistry.
eligibility: Anyone in need of dental care
requirements: Sliding scale based on income/household size

name: Jefferson Dental Clinics of Houston
description: Provides preventative dentistry, teeth cleaning, dental fillings, dental crowns, emergency care.
eligibility: Anyone in need of dental care

name: Vecino Health Centers
description: Provides examinations, extractions, cleanings, fillings.
eligibility: Anyone in need of dental care

name: Legacy Community Health
description: Provides general dentistry (cleaning, exams), oral surgery, orthodontics.

name: Repite and Recuperative Care Center (RRCC)
description: Provides temporary shelter, medical care, food stamps and legal assistance, computer access.
eligibility: Currently established with Harris Health System

name: Men's Shelter by Txbunkhouse
description: Provides shelter, locker storage, on-site laundry, TV room, full service kitchen.

name: Myriam's Hostel Emergency Shelter
description: Provides temporary shelter for up to 14 days, meals (dinner and breakfast), personal hygiene resources.
eligibility: Must have photo ID or driver's license

name: Shelter Program
description: Provides safe housing, temporary shelter, group therapy, 3 meals/day.
eligibility: Individuals and families fleeing from abuse

name: Midtown Home: Emergency Shelter for Homeless
description: Provides 3 night emergency stay, meals, clothing, medical care.

name: Crisis Care Services
description: Provides shelter, hot meal, emergency medical care, showers, mental health and legal care.

name: Counseling by Healthcare for the Homeless Houston
description: Provides individual counseling.

name: Project Shalom
description: Provides individual/group/family counseling, support groups, meals and recreation.

name: Texas Mental Health Program for Veterans
description: Provides mental health care, counseling, substance abuse counseling.

name: Counseling Services by Houston Area Women’s Center
description: Provides individual counseling, group counseling and support groups, accompaniment to law enforcement.
eligibility: Domestic violence or sexual assault survivors

name: SNAP Food Benefits
description: The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) provides food benefits to low-income families to supplement their grocery budget.
eligibility: Adults age 18-52 with no children (must look for a job/be in an approved work program)
Elderly (60+) or disabled individuals (TSAP with 3 year term benefits)

name: AirTalk Wireless
description: Provides free quality smartphone device and free phone service plan with unlimited talk and text.
services: Free phone service plan with unlimited talk and text
eligibility: Must be a benefit recipient of programs such as WIC, SNAP, Medicaid, etc., OR meet income qualifications

name: Lifeline Mobile Phone Program by Assurance Wireless
description: Provides a free smartphone, 4.5 GB of free data each month, unlimited free texts each month, 1000 free voice minutes each month.
services: 4.5 GB of free data each month
eligibility: Must participate in a qualifying program
Income at or below 135% of federal poverty guidelines

name: Lifeline Cell Phone Service by EnTouch Wireless
description: Provides free wireless service.
eligibility: Must participate in a qualifying program OR have income at or below 135% of federal poverty guidelines

name: Lifeline Program by TruConnect
description: Provides free unlimited talk, free unlimited text, free international calls to Mexico, China, South Korea, Vietnam, and Canada.
services: Free International calls to Mexico, China, South Korea, Vietnam, and Canada
eligibility: Must participate in a qualifying program
Income at or below 135% of federal poverty guidelines

name: Project Access
description: Houston’s only regularly scheduled free transportation service for individuals seeking housing, available Monday through Friday.
services: Free transportation service for individuals seeking housing
requirements: Riders can register by calling the number above or visiting a ticket site partner.

name: METRO
description: Public transportation service with various payment options.
requirements: Purchase at Metro RideStore, vending machines, or online

name: METRO Q-CARD REDUCED FARE
description: 50% reduced fare for students, seniors, Medicare cardholders, and the disabled. Children <5 yrs ride for free.

name: METROLIFT
description: Curb to curb transportation for people with disabilities who meet certain eligibility requirements.

name: RIDES
description: Provides transportation services for older adults and people with disabilities unable to use alternative transportation.
eligibility: People with disabilities unable to use alternative transportation
hours: Mon-Fri for ride-sharing; Same-Day Taxi available 24/7
requirements: Clients may be enrolled with only one agency or through direct enrollment with RIDES

name: Non-emergency Medical Transportation Program
description: Provides non-emergency rides to the doctor, dentist, and drug store for people with Medicaid, children who get services through Children with Special Health Care Needs program, or people in Transportation of Indigent Cancer Patients program.
eligibility: Children in Children with Special Health Care Needs program
People in Transportation of Indigent Cancer Patients program

name: Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) Paratransit
description: Provides transportation services for individuals with disabilities who can’t use the fixed route bus system for specific trip needs. These services cover areas within ¾ mile of a fixed route.
eligibility: Individuals with disabilities who can’t use the fixed route bus system
requirements: To schedule a trip, call office at least one day in advance
Fare for each one-way trip is $2.00
